Class ec.evm$.ObjectSubstitute 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.evm$.ObjectSubstitute
public class ObjectSubstitute
extends Object
This class has statics that are the targets of many of the guest loader transformations. The transformations are described in more detail on each method.

ObjectSubstitute()

consistencyCheck(Object)
Implementation from evm$.Inhabitant, sort of.
evm$getClass(Object)
Get a Class interface object for the given object.
invoke(Object, Method, Object[], Result)
Implementation from evm$.Tether, sort of.

Queue a Runnable on the current vat's run queue.
respond(Object)
Implementation from evm$.Inhabitant, sort of.

ObjectSubstitute 
 public ObjectSubstitute()

evm$getClass 
 public static Cla evm$getClass(Object target)
Get a Class interface object for the given object. The guest loader transforms Object.getClass into a call to this method.

Parameters:
target - the object whose class is wanted
Returns:
the wrapped Class object
queue 
 public static void queue(Runnable runnable)
Queue a Runnable on the current vat's run queue. Note, this is a static method that will often get "compiled" by the guest transformer into a call to vat.evm$queue (runnable) where "vat" is replaced with the current vat by the guest transformer.

Parameters:
runnable - the Runnable to queue up
respond 
 public static Object respond(Object target)
Implementation from evm$.Inhabitant, sort of. Tell the given object to respond. This is used for shortening channel chains. We'd like this to be an instance method on Object, but instead we have this static.

Parameters:
target - the "this" pointer
Returns:
the result of calling the respond instance method on the target, or the target itself if it is not an Inhabitant
consistencyCheck 
 public void consistencyCheck(Object target) throws InconsistentException
Implementation from evm$.Inhabitant, sort of. We'd like this to be an instance method on Object, but instead we have this static.

Parameters:
target - the "this" pointer
Throws: InconsistentException
thrown if the consistency check fails.
invoke 
 public static void invoke(Object target,
                           Method method,
                           Object args[],
                           Result result)
Implementation from evm$.Tether, sort of. We'd like this to be an instance method on Object, but instead we have this static.

Parameters:
target - the target of the invocation
method - the method to call
args - the arguments to pass
result - the channel for the result. It may be null to ignore any resultant value or exception.
